notes.p: From the same centre as MIrA 224 (Lowe). The two parts were united early, to judge from continuous quire signatures. Bischoff detected 9th-century Nonantola script in titles on Vat. 14r and Flor. 1r.
The Florence section (Ambrosiaster) was apparently already dismembered in the 9th century (Lowe). An eight-leaf quire is now missing between folios 41 and 42 (Chisholm).

manuscript.notes: Old Irish glosses (ed. Lambert 1986***); language c. 800.

description.contents: Probus, De Catholicis, De Prosodia ad Marcellum; Charisius, Ars Grammatica; Excerpta

manuscript.notes: CLA: "Irish hands at Bobbio in the eighth century restored in the margin damaged portions of the original text (foll. 109–110) and made two large additions… The text of Servius de Finalibus was entered, doubtless at Bobbio, by an eighth-century Irish hand on fol. 139v—a page left blank at the end of the MS of Claudius Sacerdos described in the next item—and continued on foll. 140–141v over an erased text of Charisius."

description.contents: Isidore, Etymologiae (1, 11, fragm.), Interrogationes et Responsiones (fragm.); Arnobius Iunior, Opus Incertum(?), Expositio in Evangelia, Computus; Caesarius Arelatensis, Homiliae (fragm.)

manuscript.notes: Book-list added to outer page (originally blank) of manuscript containing shorter works of Augustine, written in uncial script, probably in Italy, in the 6th or 7th century. Came to Lorsch by 9th century. Some letters in Irish script also in left margin of f. 147v.
Lowe: One word (nostram) added in eighth-century Irish minuscule on p. 13 over a gloss in the lower margin.

notes.p: Scribe Edilberict, son of Berictfrid (f. 46r). Lowe: "The tur-symbol points to an English scriptorium, as do the vernacular glosses, but script and decoration point to Ireland."
25 Old Irish, 5 Old English glosses. See Psalter of Caimín (Dublin, UCD, Franciscan A 1, late 11th century), where most of the glosses correspond verbatim.
Carmina 15, 16, 18, 28, 27, 17. Display script (ff 4r, 16v, 20r). Calligraphic flourishes, esp. in column ends and on final page (29v).
Closely related to St Petersburg, National Library of Russia, MS Q.v.XVI.1. Single Old English dry-point gloss on f. 24r. See references in Gneuss & Lapidge on Northumbrian origin.

contents.summary: Augustine, In Epistulas Pauli ad Romanos et ad Galatas

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: Expositio quarumdam propositionum ex epistula ad Romanos

manuscript.notes: 34 folios (incl. "18" and "18a", hence only 33 counted in Lowe). From the same centre as MIrA 112 (Lowe). See further there.

notes.p: Composite manuscript, part 24. Several hands. Two Irish glosses (f. 45r): ianair and marta (month names).
Lowe (CLA S.1734) suggests that this may belong with other compustistical binding fragments brought from Ireland to Bobbio, also containing Old Irish glosses (see MIrA 133).
Bischoff (1977: 49) identifies the scribe of the zodiacal tract on f. 45r with the scribe of the same text on f. 13v in the Karlruhe Bede (MIrA 60).

manuscript.notes: Heavily glossed, some apparently in Irish script (Bischoff).
Old Irish glosses (41). Glosses from Haimo of Auxerre and Eriugena.
Corrections in Irish hand and Caroline hand with Irish influence.

description.contents: Bede, De temporibus, De natura rerum, etc.

manuscript.notes: Bischoff: abbreviations show strong dependence on Irish exemplar.

description.contents: Jerome, De viris illustribus; Decretum Gelasianum; Gennadius, De viris illustribus; Isidore, De viris illustribus; Augustine Retractationes; Cassiodorus, Institutiones (book 1); Isidore, Prohemia, extracts from De ecclesiasticis officiis, De ortu et obitu sanctorum patrum, Allegoriae

manuscript.notes: Bischoff: Irish exemplar? Mynors (ed.), Cassiodori Senatoris Institutiones (Oxford, 1937), pp XV–XVI: Irish abbreviations for autem and per sometimes taken over, sometimes wrongly interpreted. Two embedded Irish glosses misunderstood: sitipio (sc. stibio): id est o dub dabrom (John Fraser: ó dub da bró); fenus: id est amthi (cf. Sg. 11b19 l: foenus: aithi).
This and Fragm. Aug. 17 detached from binding of Aug. 167 (Bede). "(Libe)r trinitatis et sci cronáni filii lugaedón." Re-written over eighth-century majuscule.
Bischoff: abbreviations indicative of Irish source?
Bischoff: Irish exemplar?
Bischoff, SSB: strong influence of Irish exemplar in abbreviations.
Bischoff, SSB and Kat.: exemplar possibly Irish (Insular influence in script and abbreviations).
Bischoff, SSB: apparently Insular exemplar (1.253); title of Irish compilation mentioned in St Gall, MS 261 (2.244). Bischoff, Kat.: Irish exemplar.

description.contents: Pseudo-Augustine, De quaestionibus Veteris et Novi Testamenti

manuscript.notes: Insular exemplar. (Same scriptorium as Augburg, Bischöfliche Ordinariatsbibliothek, 2.)

description.contents: Isidore, Differentiae; Gennadius, De Ecclesiasticis Dogmatibus

manuscript.notes: CLA: "The manuscript opens with the formula: 'In nomine dei uiui’, found elsewhere only in the Irish Orosius, Milan Ambros. D. 23 Sup. (CLA 3.328), which suggests that the exemplar may have been Irish."
CLA: "resembles certain hands in Vatic. Pal. Lat. 235 (CLA 1.87) and probably the work of a Northumbrian scribe schooled in the Irish tradition"

description.contents: Claudius Sacerdos, Artes Grammaticae; Probus, De Catholicis

manuscript.notes: CLA: "Was in the hands of Irish scribes, no doubt at Bobbio, in the eighth century, when the leaves originally left blank (foll. 139v–141v) were used for copying a text of Servius."
A copy by Jodocus Metzler (1574–1639) of the Abbey of St Gall, apparently from a lost Bobbio codex in Irish script. The only MS witness for Columbanus, Letter 1–5.

CLA: "An Insular hand added various critical signs passim in the margins, as l for 'lege', quotation-marks, and entire words (foll. 73v, 85v): it is the hand of the scribe of Clm 14666 (saec. IX)." Signs identified as Irish in Steinová 2017: 66***.
Bischoff, Kat, identifies scribe as prob. British. But apparently also the same hand as the (Irish) annotator of Clm 14425.
Insular exemplar. CLA: "whole words or sentences are for no good reason transcribed in Greek letters—an Insular trick (on foll. 132, 136v, 172v)".

description.contents: Augustine in Psalmum CXVIII; Hymni; Preces; etc.

manuscript.notes: Bischoff, SSB: prayers on f. 163ff of Irish origin.
Bischoff SBB: A few corrections in an Insular, prob. Irish, hand (e.g. f. 15r); identified in Addenda with hand of Sedulius Scottus in the Arsenal Psalter.

description.contents: Eutyches, Ars de verbo; Isidore, Etymologiae (excerpts); etc.

manuscript.notes: Bischoff, SSB: At least uncalligraphic hands. Strong Insular, esp. Irish, influence in script and contents.

description.contents: Maximus Victorinus, De ratione metrorum; Metrorius, De finalibus syllabis

manuscript.notes: Two mutilated bifolia in Vienna, one in Munich. Older palimpsest text in Munich is Matthew (Vetus Latina). Bischoff, SSB: Insular orthography (incl. -ís) points to Irish exemplar.
Exemplar possibly brought by Virgil of Salzburg. One of several Salzburg manuscripts with Irish exemplars, according to Bischoff, SSB, 2.55–60, 83 (listed at p. 55, n. 13).
Possibly from the time of Virgil of Salzburg. See note to Vienna, Lat. 2195.
Possibly from the time of Virgil of Salzburg. See note to Vienna, Lat. 2195.

description.contents: Anonymi Scoti Commentarii in evangelia Lucae et Iohannis; Jerome, Interpretationes; etc.

manuscript.notes: See note to Vienna, Lat. 2195. Very finely written and decorated. Saint-Amand trained scribe.
See note to Vienna, Lat. 2195. (Images for Clm 18119 not found.)

contents.text: Lathcen, Ecloga ex Gregorii Magni Moralibus in Iob

manuscript.notes: See note to Vienna, Lat. 2195.
See note to Vienna, Lat. 2195.

description.contents: Miscellanea; Versus Salisburgenses; Bede, De natura rerum; etc.

manuscript.notes: Bischoff, SSB: collection of Canons (with Greek uncial M for Moses, f. 132v ff.) possibly from an Irish archetype. See note to Vienna, Lat. 2195.

description.contents: Sedulius Scottus, Commentarius in Matthaeum; Excerpta varia

manuscript.notes: Bischoff, SSB: Irish abbreviations indicates proximity to original.

description.contents: Augustine, Sermones de verbis domini et apostoli

manuscript.notes: Circle of Eriugena.
Bischoff, SSB: exemplar prob. Irish.
